topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53422b696368722eedc80000#post_53422b696368722eedc80000
The only "sport" I care about is swimming.  I love to swim.  My personal record for how long I can hold my breath underwater is five minutes and swim down to about a hundred feet.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53422d476368722eed500100#post_53422d476368722eed500100
I should mention I don't hate sports, I hate _competitive_ sports. I too love swimming especially diving and snorkeling, it's a lot of fun. I also love mountain biking and biking in general, dirt biking, kayaking, flying (_really_ expensive), hang gliding, hiking...well let's just say a lot of things, but turning them into competition takes all the fun out and makes it into an uncomfortable task for me.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5342319363687208ea7b0100#post_5342319363687208ea7b0100
Nope. It takes knowledge and skill. Ever watch a pro fisherman? They catch fish within minutes because they know where to fish, what lure to use, and what time to fish.

One of the best techniques out there is the dying minnow trick; you get a lure that looks like a minnow or even use a real one if you can and basically jerk it through the water very erratically but not too hard. This looks like an injured/dying fish and fish will go after it even if they are not hungry. This is because it's an easy meal that can't swim away.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

Also try stevia, it's a natural alternative to sugar that's both tasty and has no nasty chemicals in it like aspartame or phenylalanine .
